text.p: Wall Street stocks opened higher on Monday, watching the bond market to see if the benchmark 30-year bond will stay below a seven percent yield and assured by personal spending and income data for April.
The Dow Jones industrial average was up 15.02 at 7,346.06, while the Nasdaq Composite gained 6.79 at 1,407.11 and the S&P Index was up 1.83 at 850.11.
The 30-year long bond gained 8/32 to yield 6.89 percent.
